page.title: 16FARMING
page.content: Leewood farm is one of the oldest in the area. There are{242 acres of land} The farmer built his house and has lived there for 25 years.{He grows } {grass for hay and has horses,goats, {ponies and chickens.}He uses tractors, bailers, ploughs,seed drills etc.Water from the farm flows under Effingham Common Road and fills the pond.The farm goes from Oriston Lane to Nightingale Road.Part of the farm is called{Pilgrim Heights}because the pilgrims passed over the land.He uses {organic fertilizers}rather than chemical fertilizers.The farm has not changed for 50 years and the farmer does not think it will. There are only a few damson trees left from an orchard.The{moat and hill}are all that remains of the old house, Leeligh Manor.
